comments:
20021016-I linux-gtk:

public class Foo {
  public static final void foo() {
    System.out.println("hello");
  }
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    foo();
  }
}

1. select method foo declaration
2. refactor inline method
3. press finish

4. press Ctrl-Z (note that the CU is dirty)

5. select method foo declaration
6. refactor inline method
7. press finish
8. observe an error dialog stating that an assertion failed

9. press Ctrl-S (CU is no longer dirty)

10. select method foo declaration
11. refactor inline method
12. press finish
13. observe that inlining works as expected again

Note: Using Refactor-Undo instead of Edit-Undo works.

I suspect that the usual check if a working copy is dirty is omitted
(usually you get the dialog asking to save).

Inline method now save all dirty editors before execution. This is necessary 
anyways since otherwise search will not provide the right search result if the 
method is referenced in a dirty editor.
